threads.text:
The design is nice. I am having a nice feeling when it's on my hand. The fingerprint sensor is marvelously fast. A camera. 

But the lacking of options when compared with its predecessor such as the double tap to wake is very frustrating. You buy a the latest flagship expecting it to have all the feature of the previous line and suddenly it's not there. Damn
It's progressing fast.
Fast enough. For now maybe.
faster but when i get the device warm, it's look like extremely slow down the device but I'm faced it in with 41.2.A.7.76 firmware. maybe fix soon.
It's fast. But I could see room for improvements.
no problem with opening apps even it's not available in RAM.
The multitasking is breathtakingly good.
Multitasking is smooth. 4GB RAM is smooth for today's level apps.
its great.. but 835 is out there
I sometimes detect lags, but this is largely due to the stamina mode perhaps, and chained with the battery drain issues.
smooth as fluid .
I have the same issue with Chrome since it has been updated some days (< 1 month) before. There are also comments from other users which basically says the same. Haven't tried other browsers yet.
Haven't use it extensively but the past week I only got the excessive heat warning pop up when i opened the camera app for a prolong time.
i have Black Device,  when ever i use the device at direct sunlight it seems absorbing heat by it's chassis and device getting hot. it seems throttle down the CPU, and it's make the device lagging.
i dont know if this is overheat or normal heat. but im sure this is the hottest one i ever used so far.
In nougat there is no heating issue when using mobile net, playing asphalt 8 or camera use. After updated to Oreo there is heating issue when using mobile net or opening apps. Why heating in Oreo?
So far superb. Better than my previous phone, z3 compact.
Really good camera but apart from slow motion, there were no other innovations on camera lens from Sony, a company someone expects a lot in the field of camera lens.

first thanks to it's motion eye camera. the image still sharp @ moving object without any blurry. but required lots amount of light. recommend to use at day time. i have tried capture a moving car 60km/hr  with distance of 5mtr. the car alloy wheels seems sharp.  that's means it's able to capture object moving at high speed without blurred.

can anyone please extract stock camera app from xz premium  . i want to try and see if it works on XZs.
so that i can finally get rid of 4K app

The standard video recording is pretty much the same like all the other flagship. But the hyped 960fps video recording is only useful in sunlight as far as I can tell. Useless at night and dark indoor environment which due to its capturing speed, it accidentally record the lighting flickers as well for those who use fluorescent.

threads.text: Not very up to speed. Still far from ok
for  me it's took 2hr to completely 1% to 100% charge.. with it's own QC 3.0 Charger.
Not sure whether it's the issue with Nougat or something else but had I known about this issue beforehand, i wouldn't have bought this phone just for this matter.
awful battery drain, in 7 hrs 25 % in standby, not acceptable in my opinion

Since the last update, 41.2.A.7.65,the battery goes down fast. I can't even get it for half a day.
Does anyone else?
same issue on the battery..unacceptable..
solved it for me.
When i hold the upper part of the phone , the wifi signal dropped from 3 bar to 1 bar . Anyone also experienced the same problem ? Is it common for xzs ? Or it's manufacture defect ?

replies.text: I've had one, but it's not common

threads.text:
Hello,

i can confirm that the Wifi reception is not the best. I had the Xperia Z2 before i switched to the XZs and the Wifi is more worse than the Wifi from the Z2. I also tryed to hold the upper section of the phone and my reception is completely away (upstairs in my house).

So i think it is not a manufactore defect.
